para: With the bounds option you can filter out tracks that don't overlap a given area.

The bounds option needs to be set to a value representing the area of interest. Tracks that overlap this area will be passed through the filter, others will be discarded. The value of the option must contain four numeric values seperated by blanks. The values are the minimum latitude, the minimum longitude, the maximum latitude and the maximum longitude of the area of interest.

example.title: Selecting tracks within a rectangular area
example.para: Suppose you want to select tracks that are on the North Six-shooter Peak 7.5 minute quadrangle. To do that, use this command line:

para.userinput: gpsbabel -i gpx -f input.gpx -x track,bounds="38.125 -109.75 38.25 -109.625" -o kml -F output.kml
